sentence.Network_en: He has done more to confuse and mystify the subject than to clear it up.
sentence.Network_cn: 他所做的恰恰是把这个学科搞得既混乱又神秘,而不是把它搞清楚.

sentence.Network_en: The result, if not the intent, is to mystify the public.
sentence.Network_cn: 结果, 如果不是有意的, 是迈向香港市民.

sentence.Network_en: I signal to Cui advance towards me and show him this mystify creature.
sentence.Network_cn: 我向崔巍示意让他马上游过来,并指出这条神秘化的鱼类!

the trick ’ s inclusion in the repertoires of some of close-up magic ’ s most illustrious performers speaks to its utterly mystifying effect on an audience .把戏的包括在一些的保留节目特写镜头魔术的最杰出的执行者与它的完全地迷惑的作用讲话对观众。

in a dead-ended valley , a mystifying village has been preserved on cliffs and mountain slopes for hundreds of years , an ancient civilization frozen by time in the deep mountains .一个此路不通的峡谷，山坡和崖壁上，一个神秘的村庄被留存数百年，古老的文明，凝固定格于壁崖间。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from French mystifier, formed irregularly from mystique 'mystic' or from mystère 'mystery'

entry.tran: 使困惑不解;使大为惊奇
entry.def: If you are mystified by something, you find it impossible to explain or understand.

example.ex: The audience must have been totally mystified by the plot...
example.tran: 观众一定是让剧情完全搞晕了。

example.ex: There was something strange in her attitude which mystified me.
example.tran: 她态度有些奇怪，让我迷惑不解。

means.word_mean: 1. be a mystery or bewildering to;

auth_sentence.content: The origins of the indigenous tribes still mystify anthropologists.
auth_sentence.res_content: The origins of the indigenous tribes still mystify anthropologists.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The origins of the indigenous tribes still mystify anthropologists.

auth_sentence.content: Foreign languages you don't understand can mystify or mesmerise.
auth_sentence.res_content: Foreign languages you don't understand can mystify or mesmerise.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Foreign languages you don't understand can mystify or mesmerise.

auth_sentence.content: Even papers in immunology or cell biology mystify me and so do some papers in my own field, neurobiology.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even papers in immunology or cell biology mystify me and so do some papers in my own field, neurobiology.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even papers in immunology or cell biology mystify me and so do some papers in my own field, neurobiology.

Sentence.sentence: Songs like "Tomorrow Never Knows", "Strawberry Fields Forever", and "A Day in the Life" featured revolutionary sound effects that dazzled and mystified Martin's American counterparts.

means.word_mean: 使(某人)困惑不解;使迷惑;使神秘化

sentences.en: He mystified us all by pouring his drink out of the window.
sentences.cn: 他把饮料倒出窗外,使我们大为困惑。

sentences.en: I’m mystified;I just cannot see how he did it.
sentences.cn: 我大惑不解, 说不明白他是怎样做到的。

sentences.en: She was genuinely mystified by her success.
sentences.cn: 她真的搞不懂自己为什么会成功。
